intro: Sisyrinchium vaginatum subsp. restioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its narrow leaves and clustered inflorescences make it a distinctive member of the blue-eyed grass genus. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
